name: Native American Genocide (US Indian Wars & Removal)

mortality.note: US-era deaths only (1830-1890). Broader demographic collapse from ~10M pre-contact to 250k by 1900 includes earlier colonial periods. Trail of Tears alone killed 15,000+. Wounded Knee, Sand Creek, and countless other massacres.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Indian Removal Act, reservation system, forced marches (Trail of Tears), boarding schools.
rationales.profit: Land seizure for settlers, gold rushes, railroad expansion. 'Manifest Destiny' as cover.
rationales.ideology: 'Savage' vs 'civilized' narratives, but land acquisition was primary driver.
rationales.complicity: US government, settlers, and railroad companies all benefited. Treaties systematically broken.

analysis.pattern_note: Manifest Destiny as genocidal ideology. Indian Removal Act (1830) legalized ethnic cleansing. Reservation system as concentration. Boarding schools ('Kill the Indian, save the man') as cultural genocide. 80% population loss in 60 years. Still ongoing effects: poverty, health disparities, broken treaties.
analysis.root_causes: Land hunger, gold discoveries, railroad expansion, settler colonialism

sources.title: An American Genocide: The United States and the California Indian Catastrophe
sources.author: Benjamin Madley
